p: Myeloid cells, e.g., alveolar and interstitial macrophages or dendritic cells (DCs), elicit different immune responses toward influenza viruses, according to their subtypes ( 66). It is thus predictable that specificities may also exist with respect to SARS-COV-2 infections. Indeed, although studies are scant, these cells have generally been shown to be poorly permissive to SARS-CoV replication ( 54, 67, 68).
